meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something soft and wet.
meanings.sent1: I squish the grapes to make juice.
meanings.sent2: She likes to squish the playdough between her fingers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squish itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The heavy raindrops squish the mud beneath our feet.
meanings.sent5: The child's laughter seemed to squish the air around us.

meanings.definition: A soft, wet sound made by pressing or crushing something.
meanings.sent1: The squish of the sponge filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I heard a squish as I stepped on the overripe tomato.
meanings.sent3: The squish of the mud under my boots was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The squish of the wet sand between my toes brought back memories.
meanings.sent5: The squish of the wet towel echoed in the empty room.

meanings.sent1: The squish mud oozed between my toes.
meanings.sent2: Her squish hands left marks on the window.
meanings.sent3: The squish sponge absorbed all the water in the sink.
meanings.sent4: The squish ground made walking difficult after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The squish cake was a hit at the party.
